intro: Doxosma, commonly known as the common doxosma, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and is often found growing in moist, temperate environments. Doxosma is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a useful plant for ecological studies and soil stabilization.
